channel.title: Any server's client?
channel.description:
Well first of all, I want to let you know that I run on a VERY low-spec computer now. The hard drive is maxxed at 10 gb, the processor is ~500 mhz, etc.
And recently I have enjoyed actually [b]playing[/b] rsps, but now everyone has their own client, and you can't test it before downloading. Its a very annoying to download a client and discover the server offers no ideas, etc for my own developement. And I'm actually unaware of how this works. But does anyone have a client with an ip/port changer, that will log on [almost?] any server. Also, if you have the time, would you mind explaining how this works? Preferably open source so I can remove anInt988++, anInt988 = 0, and if(anInt1278 < -##). I can use the class>java decompiler if neccesary, but those events are just annoying :P [camera position moves over tiem lol].
Thank you so much in advance, and Merry Christmas!

item.title: Any server's client?
item.dc:creator: @imsokool22 imsokool22
item.description:
@imsokool22 wrote:

zach you dont understand that all servers are not the same so it wouldnt work and plus servers that are different ahve files different ways to liek packaged and normal 508’s tend to be packaged but some 317 are packaged to.

Read full topic

item.title: Any server's client?
item.dc:creator: @Owned_Pl0xs Owned_Pl0xs
item.description:
@Owned_Pl0xs wrote:

[quote=“00zach000, post:4, topic:321968”][quote author=Graham link=topic=418387.msg3075187#msg3075187 date=1261777392]

that isnt possible because not every server is the same if your look for silab or blurrs it depends on the base if the client will work with it

Some servers have the extra byte for headicons in the player update task, and some clients have custom interfaces and other stuff which is a shame as it would be good if you only had to use one client.

It is a really annoying problem, one of the reasons I tend not to play any servers.
[/quote]
So what if I were to throw all of the aforementioned into one client?[/quote]

Nope.

Read full topic
